datas.title: EstoyOnline | Start your Spanish learning journey
datas.description: At our online Spanish school, EstoyOnline.es, based in Barcelona, we teach Spanish in a fun and engaging way, much different from traditional methods. Thanks to our modern techniques, learning Spanish online has become an enjoyable and exciting process.

home.LearnSpanishtitle: Learn Spanish while having fun at our online Spanish school
home.LearnSpanishdescription: At our online Spanish school based in Barcelona, EstoyOnline.es, we teach Spanish in a way that's very different from traditional methods‚Äîthrough fun and enjoyment. With our modern techniques, learning Spanish online becomes a truly enjoyable and engaging experience. Fun activities and games boost motivation, reduce stress, and make language learning easier. They also promote natural language use and help strengthen social bonds. Learning a language in a fun way not only improves retention but also enhances your overall language skills effectively. All our teachers are native Spanish speakers from Spain and Latin America. All classes are held online via Zoom.
home.homeAboutDescription: I'm the founder of EstoyOnline.es, a Spanish school with over 300 active students.
home.homeAboutDescription2: I can‚Äôt wait to tell you more about our online Spanish school and online lessons.
home.homeAboutDescriptionBold2: I look forward to hearing from you on WhatsApp.
home.homeSubAboutTitle: With our native Spanish-speaking teachers, you'll learn Spanish naturally and enjoyably. We can't wait to meet you.
home.testimonies: What do our students say about us?

teachers.teachersTitle2: Let the sun warm your words

teacher.name: ALEJA
teacher.about: Aleja previously taught at Saint Michel High School and the Cervantes Institute. She organized 'Solo hablamos Espa√±ol' gatherings for Spanish practice. Throughout her teaching career, she enhanced her skills with international training courses, including ELE, DELE, AVE, and Int House certifications. In 2019, she founded her own school in Spain, developing modern, engaging, and conversation-focused teaching methods. She and her team continuously refine their teaching approach by incorporating new technologies and reviewing class recordings to identify areas for improvement. Her personal interests include tango and rowing off the coast of Barcelona.

teacher.name: CAROLINA
teacher.about: Carolina is a passionate teacher with experience at all educational levels. For 15 years, she lived in Patagonia, where she worked as a teacher and teacher trainer. Music is another of her passions; she plays various instruments (guitar, keyboard, ukulele, etc.) and sings in choirs. She has also taken musical comedy lessons and participated in numerous musicals. In 2021, she obtained a certification in teaching Spanish to foreigners and began teaching online and in-person at various platforms and institutes. To facilitate learning, she emphasizes the use of games and alternative tools in conversation classes, private lessons, and regular courses.

teacher.name: DANIELA
teacher.about: Daniela is from Argentina and lives in Buenos Aires. She is passionate about teaching and began teaching Spanish to foreigners in 2004. In 2008, she opened her own school, which became part of a university in 2015. In addition to her native Spanish, she is fluent in French, English, Portuguese, Hebrew, and Italian. She holds a degree in Communication Sciences and has studied Literature at the University of Buenos Aires and Linguistics and French Literature at Tel Aviv University. She enjoys spending her free time with her children and family and traveling.

teacher.name: MELISSA
teacher.about: Melissa was born and raised in Colombia and currently resides there. She has worked as a librarian and taught library skills at all levels. She holds a master's degree from B√©ziers, France. Since 2010, she has taught French, English, and Spanish at various academies. In her free time, she enjoys knitting dolls, singing with friends, and cooking.

teacher.name: SABRINA
teacher.about: Sabrina has always been passionate about language. She enjoys reading and editing texts. She studied journalism and worked as a sports reporter for radio and newspapers. Since 2011, she has been involved in CoPeHU pedagogical studies, researching purposeful learning and participating in creative writing workshops. In 2021, she combined her passions for communication, education, and cultural exchange, obtaining an ELE Spanish teaching certification. She incorporates digital tools and games into her teaching methods at various academies and e-learning platforms. In 2022, she began training ELE teachers at the Teacher Training Institute.

teacher.name: MAITA
teacher.about: Maita is a teacher of English and Spanish. She initially studied architecture but discovered her passion for language teaching and changed her career path. She focuses on personalized language instruction based on individual student needs and has developed her skills in this area through various courses. She is experienced in effectively integrating digital tools into her classes and emphasizes the use of games as a teaching method. Another of her passions is cooking, and she enjoys exploring the intricacies of Spanish and Latin American cuisine.

teacher.name: ANITA
teacher.about: Anita is from Ecuador and holds a degree in Communication from Universidad de las Am√©ricas in Quito. She also has a certification in Spanish grammar and teaching methodology. She gained experience teaching Spanish to foreigners at the Instituto Internacional de Espa√±ol. In recent years, she has been teaching private and group online lessons to students from various countries, allowing her to interact with diverse cultures. She enjoys graphic design, photography, listening to music, salsa dancing, and traveling.

teacher.name: VIRGINIA
teacher.about: Virginia pursued her passion for literature by embarking on a teaching career. She studied at the University of Buenos Aires, earning a degree in literature, and became a language and literature teacher. She spent five years in Italy, an experience that deepened her understanding of literature and culture. She currently teaches language and literature at a public school in Buenos Aires, sharing her love of literature with her students. She also teaches intermediate and advanced Spanish classes at our school. In her free time, she enjoys cycling through the streets of Buenos Aires and growing organic vegetables in her garden.

videos.title: A2.1 Basic Level Spanish
videos.description: By this level, our students have progressed enough to hold simple conversations.

videos.title: A2.1 Basic Level Spanish
videos.description: Our teachers use creative methods and everyday objects to ensure lessons are enjoyable.

videos.title: A2.2 Intermediate Level Spanish
videos.description: Students at the A2.2 level can make detailed descriptions with a broad vocabulary and comprehensive grammar usage.

videos.title: A2.3 Intermediate Level Spanish
videos.description: At the A2.3 level, dialogues reach a normal speaking pace, and specialized terms are used.

videos.title: B1.6 Advanced Level Spanish
videos.description: Advanced students have no difficulty understanding and using the fast-paced spoken Spanish.

videos.title: B1.6 Advanced Level Spanish
videos.description: Advanced students are now fully adapted to the speed of Spanish.

content.contentDescription: This course is designed for students new to Spanish. While some may have prior exposure through apps or other means, a solid foundation is built from the beginning. In the initial lessons, limited English is used to aid comprehension, gradually decreasing as students' Spanish proficiency develops.

Lessons are conducted online via Zoom, held once a week for 2.5 hours, including a 15-minute break. All lessons are recorded and available for students to download and review. Course materials and essential information are accessible at any time through Google Classroom.

The beginner level includes two courses:
- A1.1 course: 40 hours (Standard: 4 months, Intensive: 2 months)
- A1.2 course: 30 hours (3 months)
Our experienced teachers use engaging and interactive methods to teach Spanish. A native Spanish-speaking teacher with basic English proficiency is assigned to this level.

Each course is limited to a maximum of 13 students. Prior to registration, a free 20-minute trial lesson is offered to assess the student's Spanish level, provide course details, and answer any questions (in English). To schedule a trial lesson, please contact us via WhatsApp.
Upon completion of each course, students will take an oral exam and receive a certificate indicating their achieved level.

Intermediate and advanced courses focus on developing speaking and listening skills alongside grammar and vocabulary. Interactive applications are used to track student progress.

From the A1.2 level, students engage in Spanish reading practice, sharing and discussing book chapters to improve fluency, expand vocabulary, and build confidence. At higher levels, newspaper articles and essays are incorporated to further enhance vocabulary.

Lessons are conducted online via Zoom, held once a week for 2.5 hours, including a 15-minute break. All lessons are recorded and available for students to download and review. Course materials and essential information are accessible at any time through Google Classroom. Each course is 30 hours in length (3 months).
Experienced teachers with expertise in intermediate/advanced level instruction and the ability to address complex grammar questions are assigned to these courses.

Each course is limited to a maximum of 13 students. Prior to registration, a free 20-minute trial lesson is offered to assess the student's Spanish level, provide course details, and answer any questions. To schedule a trial lesson, please contact us via WhatsApp.
Upon completion of each course, students will take an oral exam and receive a certificate indicating their achieved level.

These courses aim to develop fluent speaking skills for students who have completed the introductory levels. Each lesson covers a different topic, focusing on everyday language use and intonation while expanding vocabulary. Students have ample opportunities for speaking practice. Conversation courses are offered at two levels:

- Beginner level: Requires completion of the A1.1 course.
- Advanced level: Requires completion of the A2.1 level.

These courses are conducted entirely in Spanish to foster authentic communication. Each course is 16 hours and has a maximum of 10 students.

content.contentTitle: B. Pasado Pisado - Spanish Past Tense
content.contentDescription:
This course focuses on mastering the three past tenses in Spanish (pret√©rito indefinido, pret√©rito imperfecto, and pret√©rito perfecto), an area that often requires significant practice. The course provides a detailed examination of the grammatical structure, along with written, oral, and speaking exercises. By the end, students will use the past tense with confidence and fluency.

Completion of the A1.2 level is a prerequisite for this course. Each course is 16 hours and has a maximum of 10 students.

This course is designed for students who want to enhance their language skills in a fun and engaging way by understanding the lyrics of popular Spanish songs. Students will learn new vocabulary and expressions, gain insights into the music Spanish speakers listen to in their daily lives, explore the biographies of Latin American singers, and practice speaking together. The instructor is both a Spanish teacher and a professional musician.

Completion of at least the A2.1 level is required for this course. Each course is 16 hours and has a maximum of 10 students.

content.contentTitle: D. Amo El Subjuntivo - Subjunctive Mood
content.contentDescription:
This course is ideal for students seeking to master the subjunctive mood in Spanish. It covers all usage types and forms of the subjunctive across different tenses, with grammar practice and speaking exercises at the end of each topic. The instructor is a philology expert.

Completion of at least the A2.4 level is required for this course. Each course is 16 hours and has a maximum of 10 students.

This course is for students who have attained a certain level of grammar knowledge but wish to improve their accuracy and fluency. Each lesson covers a different grammar topic, totaling 8 lessons. The final lesson is a comprehensive review to solidify understanding. The instructor has specialized training in teaching intermediate-level grammar.

Students who have completed the A2.2 level are eligible for this course. Each course is 16 hours and has a maximum of 10 students.

Complementary courses are designed to be taken alongside regular lessons without overwhelming students, allowing for accelerated learning. Lessons are conducted online via Zoom once a week for 2 hours. All lessons are recorded and available for students to download and review. Course materials and essential information are accessible at any time through Google Classroom.

Prior to registration, a free 20-minute trial lesson is offered to assess the student's Spanish level, provide course details, and answer any questions. To schedule a trial lesson, please contact us via WhatsApp.
These courses do not include exams, and therefore, no certificates are issued.

People aged 14 and up take Adult Private Lessons.
These lessons are customized based on the student's interests and topics they are curious about. Video recordings are not kept. Lesson times are arranged with the teacher. Adult private lessons last 1 hour, and you can have lessons twice a week if desired. The total number of lessons depends on your request. Your teacher will recommend the most suitable program for you.

For children aged 6-13, Kid's Private Lessons are available. Vocabulary and grammar are taught through games, songs, and fun activities. The teacher-student relationship is unique and special in children's lessons, and our teachers have deep experience working with kids. If requested, lessons can be recorded, and a weekly progress report is sent to the parents. Children's private lessons last 45 minutes.

Payments for private lessons are made in packages of 5 or 10 hours. For more details, please send us a WhatsApp message.

cards.title: Payments
cards.description: All payments are made by credit card.

cards.title: Refunds
cards.description: No refunds or course changes are allowed after lessons have started, even if you have not attended.

items.lastComment: I've always loved Aleja and her teaching methods

items.firstComment: Thanks to Aleja and her team whom I met years ago, I've progressed to the point where I can comfortably speak and read Spanish. I reached B1.4 level just by taking lessons from this school
items.lastComment: I reached B1.4 level just by taking lessons from this school

items.firstComment: Hola! Spanish lessons with songs are so enjoyable. I'm learning about Spanish singers and culture that I didn't know before. I'll recommend it to my friends. So glad I met you.
items.lastComment: Spanish lessons with songs are so much fun.

items.firstComment: Amazing teachers, amazing methods. I don't even notice how time flies during lessons. I've been learning Spanish with you since 2020, the lessons are very enjoyable and productive. My level has improved significantly with your help.
I started Spanish from scratch 3 years ago. Thanks to @estoyonline.es and @danielasalzman, I reached B2.2 level. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to learn Spanish.üòç
items.lastComment: Thanks to @estoyonline.es and @danielasalzman, I reached B2.2 level

items.firstComment: I literally said 'wow'. You're a teacher and you're still improving yourself. 'I'll soon start applying everything I learn to my lessons' - what a beautiful sentence, I could even feel your excitement üòä I loved it‚ù§Ô∏è Teacher‚ù§Ô∏è
items.lastComment: I literally said "wow". You're a teacher and you're still improving yourself.

items.firstComment: I've just completed one level and moved to the next. Our lessons with Carolina are very fun, productive, full of information, our teacher is very cheerful and helpful. items.lastComment: I overcame my fear of speaking and became very motivated.

items.firstComment: Recomiendo las lecciones de Aleja, son muy divertidas

Thanks to Aleja and her team. The best part about learning Spanish is that the teachers are Spanish. It makes understanding easier.. As a foreign language teacher myself, I started learning Spanish as a third language two months ago.. I'm at A1.1 level and will continue learning when I have time.. See you in the next course

items.firstComment: I actually started learning Spanish in 2019, but after starting to work with you, my Spanish improved a lot. Yesterday I spent time chatting in Spanish with a family from Buenos Aires and a family of 7 Argentinians. Being able to communicate with them fluently and comfortably made me very happy. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
items.lastComment: After starting to work with you, my Spanish improved a lot.

items.firstComment: Since the pandemic, we've been having enjoyable lessons with Aleja and Dani. Their energy has helped me maintain my motivation. I definitely recommend them to anyone who wants to learn Spanish. üôåüòç
items.lastComment: Their energy has helped me maintain my motivation..

items.firstComment: I received my certificate today. Many thanks to Aleja and her staff, they are very professional. At first, I was scared that all teachers were foreigners and spoke Spanish from the first lesson. But it wasn't as I thought. I definitely recommend Aleja and her team.
Lessons are very fun, we talk a lot, play games, and while doing these we learn grammar and new words. I can't wait to move to the next level üòä.
items.lastComment: Lessons are very fun, we talk a lot,
